articles.author: JACK BROOK, STEPHEN SMITH and SARA CLINE
articles.description: NEW ORLEANS (AP) — The man responsible for the truck attack in New Orleans on New Year's Day that killed 14 people visited the city twice before and recorded video of the French Quarter with Meta smart glasses, an FBI official said Sunday.
articles.title: Man behind New Year's attack visited New Orleans before, recorded video with smart glasses, FBI says

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: President Joe Biden is decrying what he calls an “unrelenting effort” to downplay a mob of Donald Trump supporters overrunning the U.S.
articles.title: Biden says Americans shouldn't forget Capitol attack -- but that there won't be a repeat this time

articles.author: FATIMA HUSSEIN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden on Sunday called on incoming Democratic lawmakers who will govern in the minority to always be mindful of other people’s perspectives — even when they may be wrong.
articles.title: As he prepares to leave office, Biden urges incoming Democratic lawmakers to reach across the aisle

articles.author: KIM TONG-HYUNG
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korea’s anti-corruption agency has requested that police take over efforts to detain impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol after its investigators failed to bring him to custody following a standoff with the presidential security service last week.
articles.title: South Korean anti-corruption agency asks police to take over efforts to detain impeached Yoon

articles.author: SAM MEDNICK and WAFAA SHURAFA
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israel has helped a former soldier leave Brazil after legal action was initiated against him by a group accusing Israelis of war crimes in the Gaza Strip based in part on soldiers' social media posts.
articles.title: Israel helps former soldier leave Brazil over investigation into alleged war crimes in Gaza

articles.author: PATRICK WHITTLE and BRIAN WITTE
articles.description: A blast of snow, ice, wind and plunging temperatures stirred up dangerous travel conditions in parts of the central U.S.
articles.title: The heaviest snowfall in a decade is possible as a wintry blast roils parts of the US

articles.author: JAKE COYLE
articles.description: Two wildly audacious films — Brady Corbet's 215-minute postwar epic “The Brutalist” and Jacques Audiard's Spanish language, genre-shifting trans musical “Emilia Perez” — won top honors at the 82nd Golden Globes on Sunday.
articles.title: 'The Brutalist,' 'Emilia Perez' triumph at Golden Globes

articles.author: VALERIE GONZALEZ
articles.description: McALLEN, Texas (AP) — When Roselins Sequera's family of seven finally reached the U.S. from Venezuela, they spent weeks at a migrant shelter on the Texas border that gave them a place to sleep, meals and tips for finding work.
articles.title: Border shelters relieved the pressure during migrant surges. Under Trump, they could become a target

articles.author: JONATHAN LANDRUM JR. and HALELUYA HADERO
articles.description: Will TikTok be banned this month? That’s the pressing question keeping creators and small business owners in anxious limbo as they await a decision that could upend their livelihoods. The fate of the popular app will be decided by the Supreme Court, which will hear arguments on Jan.
articles.title: TikTok creators left in limbo while awaiting decision on potential platform ban

articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A woman who worked as a hairstylist for Fox Sports alleges in a lawsuit that former host Skip Bayless made repeated, unwanted advances toward her — including an offer of $1.5 million to have sex with him.
articles.title: Lawsuit alleges Fox Sports ex-host harassed hairstylist and offered her $1.5M for sex
